Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery band-cup; interior glazed black; exterior: glazed at top break; in handle zone black-figure decoration consisting of part of siren to right, with added red on wing, faded added white on face and chest.
Curator's comments: For parallels regarding the siren, see Vierneisel, K. and Kaeser, B., Kunst der Schale. Kultur des Trinkens. Munich 1990, 31, fig. 2.14 and 159, fig. 25.7a.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0473) (Phase 1)
